answerText: Schwann cells or neurolemmocytes [prompt on "glia," "neuroglia," or "glial cells"][10] Schwann cells and oligodendrocytes are myelin-producing variants of these cells that support neurons in the brain and the peripheral nervous system.
heading: STIMPY |2015 | MIT A - Michigan B | 10 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: In 2013, doctors at The Miami Project to Cure Paralysis performed the first FDA-approved transplant of these cells to treat a spinal cord injury. For 10 points each: [10] Name these cells that produce myelin sheath and wrap it around nerve cells at neuromuscular junctions.
